Bugfixes: Fix crash on initial machine build

Features: Use 0.17 API to request entity status
Bugfixes: Fix status lamps for laboratories

Changes: Version bump to 0.17 (not using any of the new faster API... sorry)

Bugfixes.change: Fixed bug introduced by 0.16 causing fluids not to be checked correctly

Changes: Changed logic for state tracking, to avoid light flickering (some machines would show as yellow for a tick per cycle, even when working 100%)

Bugfixes: Fixed lights on uranium miners without mining fluid
Fixed hotkey and interface issue
Quick fix to remove spam messages

Changes: Cached options values (turns out fetching them all the time is quite slow)

Bugfixes: Collision mask added, so you can again walk through the indicator lights
Switching to high contrast mode was broken by 0.6.1, which is now working again
Using car as base type had unintended consequences, so now using storage-tank instead.

Optimizations.change: Indicator lights are now based on rotating an entity instead of destroying and creating.

Bugfixes: Rolled back a rebuild optimization, which used too much ram.

Changes.change: Code Restructure for 0 error/warns in linter.
Ton of bug fixes and robustness improvements (incl. fixing desync issues).

Changes: Changed data structure from list to table, to allow for the following:
Removed entities now have their associated lights disappear instantly, instead at next update.
Mod now scales to larger factories, since removing elements (either from mining or destruction) is now expected constant time instead of linear in the number of lights.
High contrast mode replaces the yellow signal with a blue signal. SHIFT-B to toggle

Bugfixes: 0.4.0 introduced caching of whether a mining drill was depleted, which was mistakenly also set if the drill was out of power.

re-introduced minor version numbers on global data. The use of function pointers inside global cause the function to be saved as well. This needs to be updated when loading a newer version of the mod, which includes minor versions.

Optimizations: Only checking for fluid output as a last resort (speeds update up quite a bit)
Clean transition from 'removing lights a few at a time' to 'all lights are off, so no need to check'.

Changes: Toggling the indicators now requires admin privileges, and toggling lights will now happen at the same rate as updates, instead of all in one tick

Bugfixes: Assemblers with fluid output now handled more consistently with the rest.
Depletion of mines fixed (now explicitly searching for ore patches, since old method sometimes failed)
Compatibility issue with unDecorator resolved
Added sanity checks, in case signal entities have been destroyed by other mods
New fantories would get a red light (but not update) if lights were turned off
Version number was not updated, which caused the position cache to not be filled, causing a crash

Optimizations.change: No longer repeatedly checking status when lights are toggled off

Changes: Confirmed working for 0.14, so updated info.json

Optimizations: Caching of light position (slightly lower CPU load)

Bugfixes: Fixed crash which could occur when removing the last assembler
Fixed issue with entity being updated multiple times per tick, incorrectly giving drills the yellow status

Bugfixes.change: Places the signals at the bottom center of oddly sized entities
Correctly handling machines idling while trying to output a bonus item

Features: Mining drills and pump jacks now also have indicator lights
Only updates 40 entities per tick, as suggested by github user zamp
Much more consistent use of red/yellow/green across different entity types
Major refactoring to handle save and load properly

Changes: Major refactoring to handle save and load properly

Features: Furnaces now also have indicator lights
Red light stays on for 5 seconds, to improve visibility (as suggested by Miravlix)
Bugfixes: Machines places by robots now also get an indicator
Old indicator lights are filtered out at load (this is a hack; the mapping should be stored in global)
New entities are now only created when state changes.
